moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 exd4 4. Nxd4 N: Up to now it is theory, 2 games between really strong GMs reached this position.
moves.16... d6: ? Here the 2 games Van der Wiel - Nikolic and Pavasovic - Bozanic continued with dxe6, which I believe is good.
moves.17. a4:
! As soon as I saw this position, I thought if his Queen wasn't going to be trapped after 17. Nxa7 Bxc4 18. Nc6, but when I got the position on my chessboard I realized Black can play 18... Qd7!!, because the pawn on e6 is pinned, and White would lose too much material for his Queen.
Finally I decided to move his Knight on a worse position.
moves.17... f5 18. a5 Nc8 19. Bc6: A little subtlety, but I believe the immediate Bd5 is equally good.
moves.19... Red8 20. Bd5: Hoping to play Nxc7! Qxc7 e7+.
moves.20... Bxb5 21. cxb5 a6: Giving up a pawn, but Black is completely blocked, and cannot do much more than this.
A blunder, but not so much better.
